title: AtoZ CSS News
tag_line: My favourite articles and news plus a new CSS tip
intro_text: For the last few weeks I've been working on a pretty rich interface of animations, transitions and 3D transforms so you might notice a bit of a theme in this weeks's hot picks. Enjoy!

news.link_comment: For anyone who's ever wanted to re-create the iOS blurred background effect, this post might be of interest. CSS Filters Level 2 and Vincent De Oliveira have your back...

news.link_text: CSS vs SVG Graphical Text Effects
news.link_comment: Sara Soueidan writes on the Adobe Dreamweaver Blog about different approaches for creating text effects; with some old and new CSS ways and smart new SVG ways.
Moving away from the CSS effects topic to something a little different: a Sass mixin that helps you debug how accessible your project is. I've yet to trial this in the real world, but it looks great!
Sarah Drasner goes over some tips and the tools that can be used to refine and debug your animations in this in-depth article for CSS Tricks.
Everyone loves a resource round-up post and here's one from Designify from earlier this year. Whether you need a physics engine or just some quick-use pre-defined animations, this post has them all.
